title: Vector Equation of a Plane Quiz
description: Test your understanding of vector equations of planes.

questions.question: What is the vector equation of a plane?
questions.explanation: The vector equation is r · n = d, where n is the normal vector and d is a constant.

questions.question: In r · n = d, what does n represent?
questions.explanation: n is the normal vector, perpendicular to the plane.

questions.question: How do you find the normal vector from three points?
options: Cross product of vectors from one point to the others
questions.explanation: Normal vector = (B - A) × (C - A), where A, B, C are points on the plane.

questions.question: Two planes are parallel if:
questions.explanation: Parallel planes have parallel normal vectors.

questions.question: The constant d in r · n = d represents:
questions.explanation: d = n · a, where a is any point on the plane, so |d|/|n| is the distance from origin.
